definition: to form/to organize/group/team/classifier for sets, series, groups of people, batteries
lump (of earth)/chunk/piece/classifier for pieces of cloth, cake, soap etc/(coll.) classifier for money and currency units

sentences.english: It is obvious that the task of chunk parsing is important and feasible.
sentences.chinese: 提出了汉语组块分析任务的重要性和可行性。

sentences.english: This paper describes a bilingual chunk alignment scheme based on word alignment.
sentences.chinese: 本文提出了一种基于词对齐的双语组块对齐的方法。

sentences.english: All the subjects were given the vibrotactile stimulation on the right leg adjoin with the ankle.
sentences.chinese: 采用组块式方法分别给予右小腿近踝部震动触觉刺激。

sentences.english: The intuition on the level of consciousness stems from the application and imagination of knowledge blocks.
sentences.chinese: 意识层的直觉缘于知识的组块化运用和想象。

sentences.english: Event-related design procedure appears to be more sensitive than block design method.
sentences.chinese: 事件相关方法可能比组块设计更为灵敏。

sentences.english: Chunk parsing is an effective method to decrease the difficulty of language parsing.
sentences.chinese: 组块分析是一种大大降低句法分析难度的有效手段。

definition: word family (cognate words within a given language)
to get a better grasp of sth
discourse/group of sentences with clear meaning/narrative
